III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/9/23, youth was stripped searched by a staff member and
was inappropriately touched. There is no report of digital
penetration.
Investigation This complaint was received on 08/14/2023 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
I spoke with Chief Administrator (CA) on 08/14/2023. She reported
staff member has been put on administrative leave pending the
investigation.
I attempted to contact Complainant on 08/15/2023. A message
was left requesting a call back.
I interviewed CA at the facility on 08/16/2023, in collaboration with
MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the facility since
05/23/2023. Youth A was involved in a car accident in 2022 and
has cognitive impairment and problems with fine motor skills.
Youth A does require help with getting dressed. Youth A’s father
passed away, so Youth A had permission on 08/09/2023 to attend
the viewing and on 08/10/2023 to attend the funeral. On
08/09/2023 CA helped Youth A get ready and the mother picked
up Youth A for the viewing. Youth A was picked up by her mother
at 2:30 pm and was supposed be returned at 7:00 pm. Youth A
returned to the facility a little after 7 pm. The mother stayed and
helped Youth A change her clothes and get ready for bed.
On 08/10/2023 Youth A was picked up by her mother at 3 pm and
returned to the facility at 7:29 pm. The mother again goes in the
bedroom with Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 4. At no point is Staff 4
alone with Youth A in her bedroom. CA said that on 08/10/2023
staff were informed by another youth that Youth A may be bringing
weed with her, so Staff 4 did search Youth A’s room prior to Youth
A returning from the funeral.
2

On 08/12/2023 Youth A reported she was strip searched by Staff
4 on 08/10/2023. On 08/13/2023 Youth A told her mother that she
was stripped searched by CA. CA said she was not at the facility
when Youth A returned to the facility on 08/09 and 08/10. Staff 4
denied doing any kind of strip searching on Youth A. Staff 4 said
she was only in the room with Youth A on 08/10 and Staff 1 and
Youth A’s mother were present in the room. CA said Staff 4 was
assigned to another youth on 08/09/2023 and did not have any
contact with Youth A. On 08/10/2023 Staff 4 was assigned to
Youth A. There are no cameras in the bedroom. CA reviewed
video footage from the hallway camera for 08/09/2023 and
08/10/2023, there is only one time on 08/10/2023 at 10:30 pm
were Staff 4 goes into Youth A’s room and she is only there for
approximately one minute. CA said when Youths go out in the
community staff are only instructed to search youth’s bags.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 08/16/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A was observed using a walker.
Youth A reported feeling safe at the facility, taking her medication
daily, and getting enough to eat. Youth A reported that staff
searched her bedroom on 08/09 and she was in her room when
staff searched her bedroom (per documentation staff did a room
search on 08/10, when Youth A was at her father’s funeral). Youth
A was asked if a body search was completed, and she said Staff 4
searched her on 08/09/2023. Youth A said when Staff 4 did the
body search her clothes were on, staff padded her on the breast
and leg area. Youth A said the search happened in her bedroom
and there was another staff present, but she could not recall which
staff was present. Youth A again said the search occurred after
she returned from the viewing and not the funeral. Youth A
reported feeling safe and did not express any concerns regarding
any staff member.
I interviewed Staff 1 via telephone on 08/25/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 is the house manager and has
been working at the facility for 3 weeks. Staff 4 reported she was
not at the facility on the evening on 08/09/2023. Staff 4 was
working on 08/10/2023 and Staff 4 was assigned as the direct
care worker for Youth A. Staff 1 was informed that staff heard a
youth say that Youth A had brought marijuana into the facility, so
she told Staff 4 to complete a room search on Youth A’s room. A
room search was completed by Staff 4, while Youth A was at her
father’s funeral. There was nothing found in the bedroom. Staff 1
denied directing or witnessing any staff strip search Youth A. The
facility policy is when youths go in the community is to search
bags or purses. She has worked in residentials for several years
3

and would never strip search or direct staff to strip search a youth.
Staff 4 was never alone in Youth A’s bedroom on 08/10/2023.
When Youth A returned from the funeral on 08/10/2023, Youth A
went to her bedroom with her mother and her mother assisted
Youth A with changing her clothes.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 08/25/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for
2 years. Staff 2 was working on 08/09/2023 but was not working
on 08/10/2023. She said Staff 3 was assigned to Youth A on
08/09/2023. She denied witnessing Staff 4 interact, go to Youth
A’s room, strip search Youth A, or have any contact with Youth A
on 08/09/2023.
I interviewed Staff 3 via telephone on 08/25/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 has been working at the facility for
3 months. Staff 3 was working on 08/09 and 08/10. Staff 3 was
assigned to Youth A on 08/09/2023, but not on 08/10/2023. Staff 3
said when Youth A returned to the facility with her mother, she
and the mother helped Youth A change. She said Staff 4 did not
have any contact with Youth A and did not strip search Youth A.
Staff 3 said staff are not permitted to strip search youths.
I interviewed Staff 4 via telephone on 09/07/2023. Staff 4 report
she has been working at the facility for six months. She recalled
on 08/09/2023 she was not assigned to Youth A, but on
08/10/2023 she was assigned to Youth A. Staff 4 denied strip
searching or having any contact with Youth A in her bedroom on
08/09/2023. She said on 08/10/2023, while Youth A was at her
father’s funeral it was mentioned that Youth A may have bought
weed the day before, so she was instructed to complete a room
search. Staff 4 completed a room search and didn’t find anything.
Youth A returned from the funeral around 7:30 pm, Youth A and
her mother went to the bedroom, she and Staff 1 followed them,
Youth A's mother helped Youth A change her clothes, after Youth
A went to the living room to watch television. Staff 4 said she was
never alone with Youth A in her bedroom. Youth A went to sleep
at 10 pm. Staff 4 said she went to Youth A’s room at 10:30 after
Youth A was asleep, and checked the basket attached to Youth
A’s walker. Staff 4 said she is aware of the agency search policy
and would never strip search any youth.
A predisposition conference held with MDHHS Specialist on
09/12/2023. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
4

Documents Reviewed:
• Room Search policy and procedures. Participants rooms
may be searched for items that are dangerous to the
participants or others (alcohol, drugs, and sharp objects).
• Staff 4 has no disciplinary actions in her employee file.
• Youth A’s treatment plan. Youth A is on general
supervision, requires help with grip and pinch, fine motor
coordination, and deficit awareness along with her ability to
independently complete basic and instrumental activities of
daily living.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff stripped searched and inappropriately touched
youth based on interviews with Staff and Youth. Youth A’s
interview was inconsistent with who and when she was searched,
so it could be determined that was striped searched.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
